poem:
**Starwatch**  

In the cold November night,  
Mars moves east—  
a bright traveler  
amidst the silent dance   
of Gemini and Cancer.  

Waxing moon, gibbous  
with stories untold,  
illuminates the traveler's path,  
lifting them higher—  
a whispered narrative  
across the sky.  
In London's quiet watches,  
they rise together.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starwatch: Waxing gibbous moon pairs with brightening Mars Mars has continued its eastward progression, crossing from Gemini, the twins, into Cancer, the crab. On the night of 20 November, it will be joined in the night sky by a waxing gibbous moon. The chart shows the view looking east from London at 23.00 GMT. As the night progresses into the early hours of the next morning, the pair will continue to rise higher into the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
